text: working issue via /review-issue [number]: Branch - Create feature branch dev: git checkout -b issue-[number]-description Analyze - Review specific issue requirements Implement - Make changes required issue Test - Verify changes work correctly Commit - Create descriptive commit: git commit -m "Fix Issue #[number]: [description]" Push - Push branch: git push -u origin issue-[number]-description Create PR - ALWAYS dev: gh pr create --base dev --title "Fix Issue #[number]: [description]" --body "Addresses Issue #[number]" STOP COMPLETELY - Output final message cease activity CRITICAL STOPPING BEHAVIOR: - creating PR, Claude MUST output: “✅ PR created Issue #[number]. Please review merge dev, run /review-issue [next-number] continue next issue.” - Claude MUST continue tasks - Claude MUST suggest next steps - Claude MUST start working next issue - conversation effectively ends user explicitly restarts /review-issue [next-number]

[STOPS COMPLETELY]  [User reviews PR #1, merges to dev]  User: /review-issue 2 Claude: [Creates branch issue-2-data-quality from updated dev]         [Checks data files, runs quality checks]         [Commits and pushes]         [Creates PR to dev]         "✅ PR created for Issue #2. title: WASH Household Level Survey Data 2018 - 2023
text: dataset contains results Sustainable Development Goals (SDG) Household-Level Survey WASH conducted BASEFlow Malawi 2018 2023, using mWater platform. data provides detailed, household-level insights access water, sanitation, hygiene, environmental conditions across different communities Malawi. row represents completed household survey includes: Survey metadata: submission date, consent, GPS location Water point information: type, method collection, region, location accuracy, altitude Water quality indicators: microbial tests, confidence levels, associated health risks Sanitation: toilet type, waste removal treatment methods Hygiene: handwashing facility availability, presence water soap socio-environmental factors: including responses structured open-ended questions 🔍 Use Cases dataset suitable range applications, including: WASH Program Monitoring & Evaluation Evaluate household access clean water sanitation services time across regions. Public Health Research Identify environmental behavioral factors contributing hygiene-related illnesses. Geospatial Analysis Map infrastructure boreholes sanitation facilities analyze regional disparities. Evidence-Based Planning & Advocacy Support national local policymakers achieving SDG 6: Clean Water Sanitation . Education Capacity Building Use training programs university courses data-driven development, environmental health, digital health systems. Data Science ML Train models predict risk patterns infrastructure needs based survey indicators.

title: WASH Household Level Survey Data 2018 - 2023
code: # Plot a bar chart for the type of toilets in use library(washmalawi) library(dplyr) library(ggplot2) library(maps) # Filter out records with missing or empty 'toilet_type' # Then count the number of occurrences for each toilet type toilet_data <- washmalawi %>%   filter(!is.na(toilet_facility_type) & toilet_facility_type != "NA") %>%   count(toilet_facility_type, sort = TRUE)  # Create a horizontal bar chart showing the number of households # using each type of toilet ggplot(toilet_data, aes(x = reorder(toilet_facility_type, n), y = n)) +   geom_bar(stat = "identity", fill = "#2C7BB6") +  # Use blue bars for counts   coord_flip() +  # Flip axes to make the chart horizontal   labs(     title = "Distribution of Toilet Types in Surveyed Households",  # Chart title     x = "Toilet Type",  # X-axis label showing toilet types)     y = "Number of Households"  # Y-axis label (number of entries)   ) +   theme_minimal(base_size = 13) # Plots maps for the water collection points  # Filter usable water point locations water_map_data <- washmalawi %>%   filter(!is.na(latitude) & !is.na(longitude))  # Ensure geo-points are valid  # Get Malawi map outline malawi_map <- map_data("world", region = "Malawi")  # Plot the water point locations ggplot() +   geom_polygon(data = malawi_map, aes(x = long, y = lat, group = group),                fill = "gray90", color = "gray70") +   geom_point(data = water_map_data,              aes(x = longitude, y = latitude, color = water_source_type),              size = 2, alpha = 0.7) +   coord_fixed(1.3) +   labs(     title = "Geo-Referenced Water Point Locations in Malawi",     x = "Longitude", y = "Latitude", color = "Water Source Type"   ) +   theme_minimal(base_size = 13) +   theme(legend.position = "bottom")

title: SDG Household Level Survey - Malawi (2018 - 2023) — washmalawi
text: dataset comprises household-level survey data collected across Malawi 2018 2023 part Sustainable Development Goals (SDG) monitoring initiative. data captures detailed information household water access, sanitation facilities, hygiene practices, environmental conditions. includes geolocation data (latitude, longitude, altitude), survey timestamps, various indicators availability handwashing facilities, type toilet used, waste treatment methods. dataset instrumental assessing progress WASH (Water, Sanitation, Hygiene) outcomes guiding evidence-based interventions underserved communities.

SDG Household Level Survey - Malawi (2018 - 2023) — washmalawi
text: tibble 23112 rows 27 variables date_submitted date survey submitted. latitude Latitude coordinate survey location. longitude Longitude coordinate survey location. water_point_identification_method Method used identify water point. traditional_authority Traditional authority area survey conducted. district District survey conducted. water_source_type Type water source used (e.g., borehole, spring, piped). water_source_location Location water source relative dwelling. water_collection_time_mins Time minutes go , get water, come back. time_not_known Indicates water collection time known. water_insufficiency_30days Whether insufficient water last 30 days. water_insufficiency_30days_not_known Indicates water insufficiency information known. water_quality_tested Whether water quality tested. bacteriological_test_done_at_location Location bacteriological test performed. parameters_tested_methods Parameters tested methods used water quality testing. chemical_quality_tested Whether chemical quality tested. arsenic_tested_water Results arsenic testing water. fluoride_tested_water Results fluoride testing water. toilet_facility_type Type toilet facility household members usually use. toilet_facility_shared Indicates toilet facility shared households. waste_removed Whether human waste facility removed periodically. waste_treated Indicates removed waste treated. waste_disposal Method used dispose treat human waste. handwash_available Whether handwashing facility available location. handwashing_water_presence Whether water observed handwashing facility. handwashing_soap_presence Whether soap detergent observed handwashing facility. handwashing_supplies_available Whether household currently handwashing supplies available.
